definition: Bo Gu (1907-1946), Soviet-trained Chinese Communist, journalist and propagandist, 1930s Left adventurist, subsequently rehabilitated, killed in air crash
old variant of 博[bo2]
extensive/ample/rich/obtain/aim/to win/to get/plentiful/to gamble
surname Gu
ancient/old/paleo-
conversant with things past and present/erudite and informed

sentences.english: Also can make gain in addition ancient frame come disjunctive space.
sentences.chinese: 此外也可制作博古架来分隔空间。

sentences.english: Andrew's been pretty good at screening.
sentences.chinese: 在做掩护方面，博古特一直做得很好。

sentences.english: "He's done a great job, " said Bucks center Andrew Bogut.
sentences.chinese: “干得很漂亮，”雄鹿中锋博古特说。

sentences.english: "I have a house, nice property, " Bogut said.
sentences.chinese: 总算有了私宅，不错的一块地产，博古特说。

sentences.english: Na clock planning revenge for Po gul.
sentences.chinese: 娜木钟策划着为博古尔报仇。

sentences.english: "I think he has a chance to be very, very good, " Bogut said.
sentences.chinese: “我想这里有机会让他变得很优秀，”博古特说。

sentences.english: "I have a house nice property" Bogut said.
sentences.chinese: “总蒜有了私宅，不错的一块地产，”博古特说。

sentences.english: I knew Po Ku was hoarding a tin of cocoa in his hut.
sentences.chinese: 我知道博古家里还藏着一罐可可。

definition: Zhang Wentian (1900-1976), CCP party leader and theorist
Kang Sheng (1896-1975), Chinese communist leader, a politburo member during the Cultural Revolution and posthumously blamed for some of its excesses
Liu Shaoqi (1898-1969), Chinese communist leader, a martyr of the Cultural Revolution
Yang Shangkun (1907-1998), former president of PRC and military leader
Mao Zedong (1893-1976), Chinese communist leader
Otto Braun (1900-1974), Comintern adviser to the Chinese communist party 1932-1939
Zhu De (1886-1976), communist leader and founder of the People's Liberation Army
Chen Yun (1905-1995), communist leader and economist
Zunyi conference of January 1935 before the Long March
Peng Zhen (1902-1997), Chinese communist leader
Dong Biwu (1886-1975), one of the founders of the Chinese communist party
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Song Renqiong (1909-2005), general of the People's Liberation Army
Hu Yaobang (1915-1989), Chinese politician
Bo Yibo (1908-2007), ranking PRC politician, served on State Council from 1950s to 1980s as colleague of Deng Xiaoping
